page.title: 18Housing. Low Income Families
page.content: {The Sutton Trust.}Our school stands in the middle of an estate of houses originally owned by Marconi Wireless for its management employees. In {1970 these homes were sold to the Sutton Trust.It exists for people with low incomes.}It has 276 homes in Great Baddow alone. It was founded by William R. Sutton. He left Â£1\ million in his will. The Trust still has a lot of money because they keep investing it.Mr Gavin the Estate Manager came to talk about the Sutton Trust.You only have to look after the back gardens. Secondary double glazing only is allowed so the exterior appearance is not changed.Mr Gavin's staff keep the grass cut for you. Once a year he visits each house to see if it is being kept clean. Trust employees do not have to pay rent.
